intro: Achyranthes patula, commonly known as slender knotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive bract structures. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with erect, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the roots are fibrous and can be used in traditional medicine. Achyranthes patula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
